items.title: Black Hammer Colorado will be hosting a candlelight vigil at...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Black Hammer Colorado will be hosting a candlelight vigil at Martin Luther King Jr. Public Library, Aurora CO on January 31st at 4:30pm MST to remember and honor the friends and family we have lost to this pandemic. We are hosting the vigil for the community to remind ourselves that we are not numbers. We are people.

The candlelight vigil will provide a vibrant atmosphere of hope with music, live performances, and community testimonials. Free KN95 masks will be provided to everyone in an effort to curb the infection rate in our communities. Clothes and food will also be provided to those in need. In a time of isolation and separation, our community deserves this moment of solace.

SUN, JAN 31 AT 4:30 PM MST

Candlelight Vigil | Food Clothes & Masks Drive

Martin Luther King, Jr. Public Library

¬∑ AuroraCauses ¬∑ 292 people

items.title: "Every day, there is a movement in every corner of the...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

"Every day, there is a movement in every corner of the country to declare that not only do Black lives matter, but that we must also create the laws and opportunities necessary to fulfill the full promise of that rallying cry. In the country‚Äôs largest majority-Black city, this movement should not be met with city leaders‚Äô efforts to suppress anyone‚Äôs First Amendment rights.

It is even more appalling that those who took an oath of office to serve the people are aiding and abetting in their suppression. We look shamefully on and scorn those who allowed and participated in the beating and undermining of civil rights icons such as John Lewis, Rosa Parks, and James Baldwin ‚Äî how can we possibly be OK with standing idly by while those who are fighting the civil rights battles of this day are abused too?"

Leaders in this majority Black city must stand up for the new generation of the civil rights movement.

freep.com

Rashida Tlaib pens oped, says she won't be silent 'as people's rights are being trampled'

Leaders in this majority Black city must stand up for the new generation of the civil rights movement.Leaders in this majority Black city must stand up for the new generation of the civil rights movement.

One of the ways that we passively reinforce respectability politics and show ourselves to be anti-poor is by attaching value of debt forgiveness to social capit...al. While student loans‚Äô impact on the economy is vast, there are scores more of poor, sick people who also deserve debt relief, advocacy, and attention.

Anyway, direct giving and mutual aid saves lives.

items.title: Our movement would not, could not exist without the Black women...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Our movement would not, could not exist without the Black women who came before us.

Happy Birthday to the one who taught us that fear doesn‚Äôt have to immobilize you.

Happy Birthday to the one who taught us to change the things we cannot accept.

...

Happy Birthday to the one who taught us that when Black women win everybody wins.

Happy Birthday Angela Davis

See MoreWorking Class History

On this day, 26 January 1944, Angela Yvonne Davis was born in Birmingham, Alabama. A communist, civil rights organiser and the third woman to feature on the FBI...'s most wanted list, for a time Davis was also closely associated with the Black Panther Party.
Davis worked at University of California at Los Angeles until being fired for her political views on the orders of governor Ronald Reagan. Soon after, Davis was arrested following the Marin county courthouse incident on bogus charges of murder, kidnapping and conspiracy of which she was later all acquitted at trial.
Davis has also been a consistent advocate of feminism which takes into account factors like race, class, capitalism and transgender rights, and highlights the vital historical contributions of Black women: "When we speak of feminism in this country, there almost always is the tendency to assume that this is something that was created by white women‚Ä¶ Women like Ida B. Wells, women like Mary Church Terrell, women like Anna Julia Cooper, are responsible for the feminist approach today that we generally call intersectionality‚Ä¶ What I want to argue is for a feminist perspective that understands that we cannot simply reform institutions like prison and the police, because they are so embedded with racism and violence that, if we're ever going to extricate ourselves from that, we have to abolish prisons".
In this collection of Davis's writings, including contributions from others like James Baldwin and Huey P Newton, Davis tells the story of her trial and incarceration, as well as the prison system in the United States in general: https://shop.workingclasshistory.com/‚Ä¶/if-they-come-in-the-‚Ä¶

See More

items.title: üéØ
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

üéØ

Ijeoma Oluo ¬∑ Instagram

A little PSA:

Hey - if you notice that a Black woman has drawn a hard line online with a white woman who is exhibiting harmful, racist behavior - showing up to ...be the gentle white woman who will explain the issue in a softer tone is often not as helpful as you think.

Black women are often dismissed and gaslit as "angry" when they set firm boundaries. If you notice a white woman treating a Black woman's boundaries as an attack, while she thanks you for your "kind" explanation - SHE IS WEAPONIZING YOU AGAINST BLACK WOMEN.

If you want to be helpful, supporting the boundaries of Black women and making it clear that abusive and racist behavior is unacceptable is the way you do it, instead of reinforcing the expectation that white women should be gently handheld out of their racist behavior.

See More

items.title: ‚ÄúThere are vast regions of Black life that have nothing to do...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúThere are vast regions of Black life that have nothing to do with suffering or oppression. We lead lives that are also filled with joy, romance, laughter and astonishing beauty, but those stories don't tend to grab the headlines. It's time to change that.‚Äù

There are vast regions of Black life that are filled with joy, romance and beauty. Here are some favorite examples.

cnn.com

We need more 'trauma-free Blackness.' Here's a start

There are vast regions of Black life that are filled with joy, romance and beauty. Here are some favorite examples.There are vast regions of Black life that are filled with joy, romance and beauty. Here are some favorite examples.

items.title: *Seguido en Espa√±ol The attacks on our immigrant community will...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

*Seguido en Espa√±ol

The attacks on our immigrant community will continue as long as they are not protected in our cities!

Black Immigrants are more likely to be criminalized by the police system or die at the hands of law enforcement. A city as diverse as Aurora must be a safe place for everyone, regardless of their race or immigration status. Aurora City Council and Mayor Coffman have he opportunity to take meaningful steps to reinvest in our community and protect ALL Auror...a Residents.

Join us on Monday January 11th 6:30pm to watch Aurora City Council Vote on the Safer Aurora and Immigrant Legal Defense Fund Ordinances.

Have your voice heard!! Share your testimony for both ordinances on Monday:

1. Call the live public comment line at 855.695.3475 and once connected press *3 to reach the operator.

2. The operator will ask which item the caller would like to speak on and place you in the queue for that item.

3. The public comment call-in line will open at 6:00 p.m. the day of the Council Meeting.

Send a loud and clear message to Aurora City Council Members and Mayor Coffman and let them know that immigrants are WELCOME in Aurora! Ask them to vote YES on the Safer Aurora Ordinance and immigrant Legal Defense Fund.

Join our movement! https://linktr.ee/COPApower

***
¬°Los ataques a nuestra comunidad de inmigrantes continuar√°n mientras no est√©n protegidos en nuestras ciudades!

Es m√°s probable que los inmigrantes negros sean criminalizados por el sistema policial o mueran a manos de las fuerzas del orden. Una ciudad tan diversa como Aurora debe ser un lugar seguro para todos, independientemente de su raza o estado migratorio. El Concejo Municipal de Aurora y el Alcalde Coffman tienen la oportunidad de tomar medidas significativas para reinvertir en nuestra comunidad y proteger a TODOS los residentes de Aurora.

√önase a nosotros el lunes 11 de Enero a las 6:30 pm para ver la votaci√≥n del Concejo Municipal de Aurora sobre las ordenanzas del Fondo de Defensa Legal para Inmigrantes y Aurora M√°s Segura.

¬°Haz que se escuche tu voz! Comparta su testimonio de ambas ordenanzas el lunes:

1. Llame a la l√≠nea de comentarios p√∫blicos en vivo al 855.695.3475 y una vez conectado presione * 3 para comunicarse con el operador.

2. El operador preguntar√° sobre qu√© elemento llama, tomara su nombre y la colocara en la linea.

3. La l√≠nea telef√≥nica para comentarios p√∫blicos se abrir√° a las 6::30 p.m. el d√≠a de la reuni√≥n del Consejo.

Env√≠e un mensaje alto y claro a los miembros del Concejo Municipal de Aurora y al alcalde Coffman y h√°gales saber que los inmigrantes son BIENVENIDOS en Aurora. P√≠dales que voten a FAVOR de la Ordenanza Safer Aurora y el Fondo de Defensa Legal para Inmigrantes.

¬°√önete a nuestro movimiento! https://linktr.ee/COPApower

items.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Denver Homeless Out LoudTHIS IS WHAT COMMUNITY LOOKS LIKE!!! While the city is traumatically displacing our residents...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280Denver Homeless Out Loud

THIS IS WHAT COMMUNITY LOOKS LIKE!!!
While the city is traumatically displacing our residents during a pandemic, we choose to be part of the solution. We now ha...ve 2 porta potties for community use. They are serviced 5 times a week AND we compensate an unhoused community member for cleaning the inside. We also increased our trash service to assist with this need. Win, win, win!
If the city needs help getting on board, we're happy to teach you how!!! We love our community!

See More

items.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
